title: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park: News Releases
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases               News Releases       Archive of News Releases          Subscribe  | What is RSS     August 12, 2016  NPS Extends Public Comment Deadline  The National Park Service (NPS) has extended the deadline for the public comment period for an Environmental Assessment (EA) for the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC) to September 14, 2016.   August 05, 2016  Water Level at Potomac River Dams 4 and 5  The lower water levels in the Potomac River will be maintained until Monday afternoon on August 8th in order to complete all required inspections.   August 05, 2016  Celebrate a Centennial of Campfires  Sing songs and listen to stories from across America’s National Parks as well as night-time themed canal stories!   July 29, 2016  Georgetown Water Levels Temporarily Lowered  The Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park will begin draining the watered canal section for five days from Fletchers Cove (Towpath Mile 3) to Georgetown (Towpath Mile 0).   July 25, 2016  VIP Speaker Series: Culverts  Steve Dean will be presenting a one hour presentation on the culverts of the C&O Canal NHP on Saturday, July 30th at 10:00 AM at the Ferry Hill Plantation House in Sharpsburg, MD.   July 22, 2016  Water Level at Potomac River Dams 4 and 5 to Be Lowered to Allow Inspection  On August 1 through August 5, 2016, the water level of the Potomac River reservoir impounded by Dam #4 and Dam #5 will be lowered.   July 15, 2016  Centennial of Campfires  Celebrate a Centennial of Campfires at the C&O Canal Great Falls Tavern   July 08, 2016  Strangers Along the Canal: Civil War Encampment  Civil War living history weekend with the 1st Minnesota Volunteer Infantry at the C&O Canal Great Falls Tavern Visitor Center located at 11710 MacArthur Boulevard, in Potomac, Maryland.   July 08, 2016  Paw Paw Tunnel Evening Tour  Looking for the Light – A Night at the Paw Paw Tunnel will take visitors back and forth through time, meeting historic characters from the tunnel’s past, during a 2-mile roundtrip lantern-led program.   July 05, 2016  New Orleans Jazz on the C&O Canal!  Join us at the C&O Canal at Williamsport as we welcome the Centennial Band to Maryland with a family-friendly, free public concert.   July 01, 2016  Independence Day Celebrations at the C&O Canal Great Falls Tavern  The Chesapeake and Ohio Canal (C&O Canal) National Historical Park will celebrate the nation’s birthday on July 1st-4th at the Great Falls Tavern.   June 30, 2016  Summer Programs at Great Falls Tavern  Summer Programs at Great Falls Tavern!   June 30, 2016  NPS Seeks Public Comment on Potomac Submerged Channel  The National Park Service (NPS) is seeking public comment on an Environmental Assessment (EA) for the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC) to construct a proposed offshore submerged channel intake in the Potomac River.   June 29, 2016  Modern Canal History  After weeks of rising expectations, the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal (C&O Canal) National Historical Park is proud to announce the Western Maryland Railroad Lift Bridge at Williamsport, the only bridge of its kind along 184.5 miles of the C&O Canal, has been raised and secured in position.   June 22, 2016  Centennial Artwork Unveiled  The Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park (C&O Canal) was pleased to unveil an original painting by internationally known artist Mark Stutzman at the annual Heritage Days Festival in Cumberland, Maryland on Saturday, June 11th, 2016.   June 15, 2016  C&O Canal Great Falls Tavern Events  The Chesapeake and Ohio Canal (C&O Canal) National Historical Park will celebrate the “Good Old Days of the Canal Era” this weekend, June 18th-19th, at the Great Falls Tavern located at 11710 Macarthur Boulevard Northwest, Potomac, MD.   June 09, 2016  C&O Canal Water Drainage  C&O Canal drains water from Fletchers Cove to Georgetown.   June 06, 2016  C&O Canal Celebrates Cumberland Heritage Days and 100 Years of NPS!  C&O Canal National Historical Park will be offering a series of programs on Saturday, June 11, 2016 as part of the annual Heritage Days Festival in Cumberland, Maryland.   May 26, 2016  C&O Canal in Western Maryland Provides Replica Launch Boat Tours and More  C&O Canal in Western Maryland Provides Replica Launch Boat Tours and More Visitor Services Beginning Memorial Day Weekend.   May 19, 2016  Biodiversity Events at the C&O Canal  The C&O Canal is joining national parks across the country to celebrate biodiversity.   May 10, 2016  National Park Service Seek Comments on Invasive Plant Management Plan for National Capital Region Parks  The National Park Service (NPS) is accepting public comments on an Invasive Plant Management Plan and Environmental Assessment (plan/EA) for 15 national parks in the greater Washington D.C. region through June 9, 2016. Comments are accepted online or by mail.   April 15, 2016  7th PA Volunteer Infantry  On April 16 and 17, 2016, the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park will host a Civil War living history weekend with the 7th Pennsylvania Volunteer Infantry.   April 06, 2016  2016 Canal Boat Excursion Season Begins  Nineteenth-century mule-drawn canal boat excursions have resumed for the Spring of 2016 at the Great Falls Tavern in Potomac, MD.   March 17, 2016  Celebration of Irish History at the Historic Great Falls Tavern March 19  Come explore and discover the story and song of the Irish at the Great Falls Tavern located in the C&O Canal National Historical Park on March 19   March 10, 2016  Replanting in Montco  Park will begin replanting at Swains Lock Hiker-Biker Campground and Rileys Lockhouse Day Use Area in Montgomery County.   February 18, 2016  George Washington Ball  On Sunday, February 21, 2016, from 1:00 p.m. until 4:00 p.m., the day before George Washington’s 284th birthday, the Great Falls Tavern will again ring with happy voices and the swish of waltzing hoop skirts, as the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park hosts Dr. Larry Keener Farley and his 19th-century dance ensemble for an afternoon of Civil War-era dance. Visitors will not only enjoy the music of Gilmore’s Light Ensemble, but will be encouraged to join in on the fun.   February 08, 2016  C&O Canal NHP Announces Conococheague Aqueduct Rehabilitation Funding Provided through the NPS Centennial Challenge Program  C&O Canal NHP Announces Conococheague Aqueduct Rehabilitation Funding Provided through the NPS Centennial Challenge Program   February 05, 2016  Winter Programs at the Great Falls Tavern  The Great Falls Tavern will be hosting several afternoon talks and presentations in the final weeks of winter.   February 03, 2016  C&O Canal Celebrates African American History Month  The C&O Canal celebrates African American history month with events and classroom visits.   January 23, 2016  Plowing and emergency response efforts continue in national parks in the Greater Washington Area  Plowing and emergency response efforts are far from over in national parks in and around the Nation’s Capital. All national park programs are canceled, and facilities will remain closed through at least Sunday.   January 21, 2016  C&O Canal NHP Cautions Visitors During Snow and Ice Events  Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park (C&O Canal NHP) urges park visitors to use caution during the snow and ice event predicted for the park beginning on Friday, January 22.   January 20, 2016  Temporary Closure of C&O Canal Towpath in Carderock Area  Temporary Closure of C&O Canal Towpath in Carderock Area   January 06, 2016  Celebrate C and O Canal National Historical Park’s 45th Birthday and the National Park Service Centennial on January 8 and 9  Join C&O Canal National Historical Park (NHP) to celebrate its 45th birthday on January 8 in Cumberland, Md. and January 9 at Great Falls Tavern in Potomac, Md.   December 30, 2015  Towpath Repair and Resurfacing  Towpath repair and resurfacing will be taking place between mile markers 117-123 starting January 4th.   December 28, 2015  C&O Canal New Year's Day Centennial Events  C&O Canal NHP celebrates the 2016 Centennial Year with park events   December 18, 2015  Chesapeake and Ohio Canal Announces New Chief of Business Management  Dr. Daniel Filer, formerly the Partnerships Coordinator for the C&O Canal, will assume his new role as Chief of Business Management on December 27th.   October 15, 2015  Entrance Road Improvement Project  Starting October 5, 2015 through January 12, 2016, safety improvement work will be performed on the entrance and access roads in the Great Falls Tavern area in Potomac, Maryland.   September 18, 2015  Rabid Deer Killed After Charging Park Ranger  Visitors advised to report contact   September 17, 2015  C&O Canal Welcomes 4th Grade Students Through Every Kid in a Park Initiative  New national program encourages families and classes to visit National Parks. Starting September 1st, 4th grade students can now go to www.everykidinapark.gov.   September 14, 2015  Battle of Shepherdstown Commemoration  C&O Canal NHP will be hosting a unique Living History event in the area around Ferry Hill Plantation and Lock 38 on the C&O Canal on Saturday and Sunday, September 19 and 20, just across the Potomac River from Shepherdstown, WV.  This event will not only commemorate the 153rd Anniversary of the Battle of Shepherdstown, but will offer visitors a glimpse into the lives of African Americans at Ferry Hill and working the Canal during the Civil War years.  The free event takes place over two days.   August 18, 2015  C and O Canal Will Celebrate Williamsport’s Canal Days on August 22 and 23  The National Park Service is turning 99 years old on August 25 and C&O Canal National Historical Park wants you to join the party! Come visit the Cushwa Basin in Williamsport, MD and celebrate with free events Saturday and Sunday August 22 and 23.   July 18, 2015  Ferry Hill Plantation in Sharpsburg, Maryland Hosts Events on July 18 and July 25  The Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park (C&O Canal NHP) announces Ferry Hill Plantation House (Ferry Hill Place) in Sharpsburg will be hosting events on Saturday, July 18, 2015 and Saturday, July 25, 2015, in conjunction with the upcoming National Park Service Centennial.   June 17, 2015  C and O Canal partners help expand outreach to WV youth  On Wednesday, June 10, 2015, local students participated in a check hand-off event with members from Freedom’s Run, Eastern Area Health Education Center (EAHEC), and the C&O Canal National Historical Park (C&O Canal) at the Cushwa Basin in Williamsport, Maryland.
